name: Hydrogen
phrase: **H**ydrant. *Blue* for "first place" (blue ribbon) and for water, its principal compound; tall and thin, shaped like a "1". Hydrant sounds like hydrogen (both refer to water).

name: Helium
phrase: **He**lium Balloon. *Silver* colored for "second place" (silver medal); a noble color for a noble gas.

name: Lithium
phrase: **Li**thium watch battery, 3-volt. *Lilac* colored (sounds like lithium and all three natural minerals are lilaccolored).

name: Beryllium
phrase: **Be**ryl-studded **Be**lt Buckle. Rectangular (4 sides), with four *pink* beryls (beryl is a pink gem: beryllium aluminum silicate).

name: Boron
phrase: **B**ox of **B**orax. 5-pound box, *dark brown*, the color of pure boron (borax is hydrated sodium borate).

name: Carbon
phrase: **C**harcoal pencil. *Black*, the color of charcoal and also of graphite (carbon) in pencil leads. Hexagonal (6-sided).

name: Nitrogen
phrase: Dynamite, or **N**itroglycerin. Two *red* sticks, shaped like a "7" (most explosives contain nitrogen).

name: Oxygen
phrase: **O**xygen-filled Life preservers. *White* for air, which preserves life. Two of them touching, shaped like an "8".

name: Fluorine
phrase: **F**luoride Toothpaste. *Purple*, the color of the mineral fluorite (calcium fluoride), and shaped like a "9".

name: Neon
phrase: **Ne**on Sign. Shaped like a "10", flashing *orange*, like the orange/red color of neon in neon signs.

name: Sodium
phrase: **Na**rrow Soda Crackers. Two of them, bright *yellow*, shaped like an "11", like the bright yellow sodium D spectrallines. Sodium is named for soda (sodium carbonate).

name: Magnesium
phrase: **M**u**g**. 12 oz. *green* mug made of olivine (magnesium silicate), filled with milk of magnesia (magnesium hydroxide). Magnesium in chlorophyll gives plants their green color.

name: Aluminum
phrase: **Al**uminum Ladder. Unlucky to walk under, and 13 is unlucky. *Turquoise (blue-green)* colored (turquoise is hydrated aluminum phosphate).

name: Silicon
phrase: **Si**licon Chip. It as 14 pins, and is the *tan* color of sand (silicon dioxide) or sandstone (silica).

name: Phosphorus
phrase: **P**hosphorus Matches. *Red/white* striped book of 15, heads white, striker red (there are both white and red forms of phosphorus). The matches could light the dynamite (nitrogen) in the periodic table.

name: Sulfur
phrase: **S**ulfuric Acid. One pint (16 oz.), *pale yellow* in a flask.

name: Chlorine
phrase: **Cl**orox. *Yellow-green* bottle, the color of chlorine gas ("chloros" means yellow-green in Greek). **Cl**eans 17 ways (Clorox is sodium hypochlorite). Note that Clorox has no letter "h" making it easy to remember the abbreviation Cl.

name: Argon
phrase: **Ar**gon-filled Fluorescent Light. 18-inch, *sky-blue* (air is 1% argon).

name: Potassium
phrase: **K**ettle, or *Pot* of *gray* *Ash*es. 19th-century way to make soap from potash (potassium is  named for potash, potassium carbonate or hydroxide, which is named for the pot of ashes used to obtain it).

name: Calcium
phrase: **Ca**lcite Pearls. *Ivory* A string of 20 pearls. Calcite is a form of calcium carbonate.

name: Scandium
phrase: **Sc**andal Page. One should be 21 years old to read the scandal page of the newspaper.

name: Titanium
phrase: **Ti**tanic. The Titanic had 2200 passengers when it hit an iceberg and sank.

name: Vanadium
phrase: Che**v** Van. 23-passenger van made with vanadium steel.

name: Chromium
phrase: Chrome-plated **Cr**eamer. 24-oz. pitcher of cream.

name: Manganese
phrase: Autu**mn** Mangos. 25 of them.

name: Iron
phrase: **Fe**rris Wheel. 26-seats and made of iron. Sounds like "ferrous", which refers to iron.

name: Cobalt
phrase: **Co**bblestone. It is a 3" cube, so it has a volume of 27 cubic inches.

name: Nickel
phrase: **Ni**ckel. In 1928, the year before the Great Depression, people had more money (a nickel) than in the next year ('29). The U.S. coin called a "nickel" used to be made of nickel.

name: Copper
phrase: Copper Penny. The **Cu**rrency during the Great Depression which began in '29.

name: Zinc
phrase: Bra**z**e**n** and zinc sink. Made of galvanized iron (iron coated with zinc), with $30 brass (brazen means brass) faucet. Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc. Sink sounds like zinc.

name: Gallium
phrase: **Ga**lleon. The old Spanish galleons had three masts, each of which looked like a "1", to remind us of 31.

name: Germanium
phrase: **Ge**rman beer. A quart stein (32 fl. oz.) of German beer. Germanium was named for Germany.

name: Arsenic
phrase: **A s**kull & crossbones. Rat poison is arsenic trioxide, commonly called simply "arsenic". In other forms, such as is found in apples, arsenic is nutritious. Arsenic has three natural varieties: black, gray and yellow, as shown by the three colors in the icon.

name: Selenium
phrase: **Se**nsitive solar *cell lean*ing. Leaning at a 34° angle off vertical. Sounds like selenium. Solar cells often contain selenium.

name: Bromine
phrase: **Br**oom. 35 Bristles (seven rows of five). In the periodic table, note that all the elements in this column are cleaners.

name: Krypton
phrase: **Kr**ypton Yardstick. One yard is 36 inches. Krypton gas was used (until 1983) to define the scientific unit of length, the meter, which is about a yard long.

name: Rubidium
phrase: Supe**rb** ruby. *Red* ruby, 37-carat.

name: Strontium
phrase: I**sr**aeli Strongbox. Bright red because the red in mostfireworks is from strontium. It weighs 38 pounds.

name: Yttrium
phrase: A Tree. **Y**-shaped, with a "39" carved in it. Sounds like yttrium.

name: Zirconium
phrase: E**zr**a's **Z**ircon **R**ing. Only cost $40.

name: Niobium
phrase: U**nb**earable Onion. "For one" person only. Sounds like Niobium and like "4,1". In Greek mythology, Niobe wept for the loss of her children, like an onion makes you weep.

name: Molybdenum
phrase: **Mo**lly's Denims. 42" waist. Sounds like Molybdenum.

name: Technetium
phrase: Du**tc**h Technician. 43-years-old. Technetium was made synthetically; it is not stable enough to be found in nature.

name: Ruthenium
phrase: **Ru**th's hen. It's feet look like 44 and "Ruth's hen" sounds like Ruthenium. It is also by the wren and ostrich in the periodic table.

name: Rhodium
phrase: Road in **Rh**ode Island. Speed limit 45 m.p.h.

name: Palladium
phrase: To**p d**og **P**alace. The sultan has 46 wives in its 46 towers, which look like "46".

name: Silver
phrase: **Ag**nes's Silver Dime. '47 was **A G**ood year after WW II. (Silver is "argentum" in Latin).

name: Cadmium
phrase: **CD** Caddy. The caddy holds 4 dozen (48) CD's.

name: Indium
phrase: India **In**k. 49 cent bottle.

name: Tin
phrase: Tin Can. Contains 50 **Sn**ails. Tin cans are made of steel sometimes covered with a thin layer of tin.

name: Antimony
phrase: Ant money. Taking **s**mall **b**ills ($5 and $1) to its pas**sb**ook account.

name: Tellurium
phrase: Deck of 52 Cards. *"**Te**ll your"* fortune (sounds like Tellurium).

name: Iodine
phrase: **I**odine. Bottle costs 53 cents.

name: Xenon
phrase: Zenith television, watching "**Xe**na". On channel 54; a TV tube contains xenon gas.

name: Cesium
phrase: **C**esium **S**tandard Clock. A physi**cs** clock. It reads 5:05; time to go home.

name: Barium
phrase: **Ba**d Berries. Poisonous. About 5/6 of all white berries are poisonous (really). Black are usually edible.

name: Lanthanum
phrase: **La**ntern. 57 candle-power.

name: Cerium
phrase: **Ce**real bowl. Has 58 nutrients.

name: Praseodymium
phrase: **Pr**aying mantis. Eats 59 bugs.

name: Neodymium
phrase: **N**o **D**im Lights. Triangular sign has 60° angles. Bright lights can bli**nd**.

name: Promethium
phrase: Prominent fire. Fire is needed after 6:10 **p.m.** Promethius brought fire to mankind. The flames look like 61.

name: Samarium
phrase: **Sm**all samurai  sword. 62 generations of use.

name: Europium
phrase: **Eu**ropean rope (63 feet long).

name: Gadolinium
phrase: Ma**gd**alene's Cattle. "Cattle" sounds like "gadol"inium. Checkerboard pattern (a checkerboard has 8x8 = 64 squares).

name: Terbium
phrase: Brigh**t b**lue turban. 65" long.

name: Dysprosium
phrase: Dan**dy** disposal. Disposes garbage in 6.6 seconds.

name: Holmium
phrase: **Ho**me. This home has room for 6 or 7 children.

name: Erbium
phrase: H**er**b (Erbium Er). The stems and leaves form a hidden 68 in the picture.

name: Thulium
phrase: Chris**tm**as Tulip. Red and green for Christmas. 69 kinds.

name: Ytterbium
phrase: Lad**yb**ug Litterbag. A litterbag (small portable trash bag), which sounds like Ytterbium, with a ladybug picture on it with 70 spots. Litterbags were popular in the '70s.

name: Lutetium
phrase: **Lu**te (Lutetium Lu). 7 Strings on 1 Lute (71).

name: Hafnium
phrase: Fait**hf**ul Half Dollar. 72 is half a gross (of 144). Also, there are 72 ounces of silver in $100 of silver halves (or quarters or dimes). The ones dated 1964 or earlier are silver.

name: Tantalum
phrase: **Ta**n **Ta**ll Man. He is 7'3" tall basketball player.

name: Tungsten
phrase: **W**estinghouse light bulb. 74 **W**att, with tungsten filament. Another name for tungsten is Wolfram, which explains the abbreviation.

name: Rhenium
phrase: W**re**n. Visualize 75 of them on a telephone line.

name: Osmium
phrase: **Os**trich. 7'6" Tall. Also, its neck & head look like a "7" and its body like a "6".

name: Iridium
phrase: **Ir**idescent Rainbow. 7 Colors in a rainbow (77). Iris was the Greek goddess of the rainbow.

name: Platinum
phrase: Platinum Record. The old kind that rotated at a speed of 78 rpm. Recorded by "The Egy**pt**ians". A platinum recording soldmore copies than a gold, and platinum is worth more than gold.

name: Gold
phrase: Gold Coin. A '79 **A.U.** (Almost Uncirculated). The latin word for gold is aurum.

name: Mercury
phrase: **H**igh-**g**rade Thermometer. Showing 80 degrees.

name: Thallium
phrase: Tallow Candle. 81. Looks like a "1" and sounds like "tallow". Used in cas**tl**es.

name: Lead
phrase: Lead Plumbing. Under the cu**pb**oard. 82% lead. The latin word for lead is plumbum.

name: Bismuth
phrase: Pepto **Bi**smol. I "ate 3" teaspoons of Pepto Bismol (sounds like "83"). Pepto Bismol contains Bismuth Subsalicylate.

name: Polonium
phrase: **Po**lo Stick. 7 dozen (84) polo sticks.

name: Astatine
phrase: **A t**all Aster (85 petals). The flowers, stem and leaf form an "85".

name: Radon
phrase: Radar wa**rn**ing. Protection for 86 miles.

name: Francium
phrase: **Fr**ance's Eiffel Tower. Built for the World's Fair and commemorated the centenniel of the French Revolution which technically began in 17**87**.

name: Radium
phrase: **Ra**dio. Piano music (88 keys) on FM 88.

name: Actinium
phrase: **Ac**tor. He won 89 oscars.

name: Thorium
phrase: **Th**orn. Thorns stick out at 90° angle.

name: Protactinium
phrase: **Pa**per protractor. Measuring 91°, one degree more than a right angle. Use it to measure the angle of the thorns next to it.

name: Uranium
phrase: **U**ranium A-Bomb. 92 Kilotons. Memorize Uranus, Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94.

name: Neptunium
phrase: Neptunia**n p**itchfork. Neptune's trident is 9' long with 3 prongs. Memorize Uranus, Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94.

name: Plutonium
phrase: Pluto the **Pu**p. Mickey Mouse's dog. Memorize Uranus, Neptune and Pluto (the planets in a row) for 92, 93, 94, and remember that Pluto's ears look like a "94".

name: Americium
phrase: **Am**erican flag. Cost $95.

name: Curium
phrase: A**cm**e's curious curtains. For a standard 8-foot tall room (96").

name: Berkelium
phrase: Ri**b k**nit Beret. '97 style. Named for Berkeley, California, where berets have been seen.

name: Californium
phrase: **C**auli-**f**lower. Remember Berkeley, California, are consecutiveand that there is a 98 hidden in the cauliflower. California produces a lot of cauliflower.

name: Einsteinium
phrase: Einstein's **es**oteric earrings. The hidden meaning is that his theory predicts you can only go 99% of the speed of light.

name: Fermium
phrase: **F**ur **m**ink. "Fur" sounds like fermium. It cost 100 thousand dollars and is 100% real fur from mink.

name: Mendelevium
phrase: Mental **M.D.**. They work on brains. Mental MD's alltook Psychology 101.

name: Nobelium
phrase: **No** Bell. The red bar divides the picture into two parts, to remember 102.

name: Lawrencium
phrase: Laurel Wreath. It has 103 leaves, and this one was also made with bu**lr**ushes.

name: Rutherfordium
phrase: Ruth's pe**rf**ect Ford. It has 4 wheels and Ford sounds like"four" to remember 104. The Model-T was so "perfect" that is was popular for many years.

name: Dubnium
phrase: 105 **d**eci**b**els dubstep music. The sound level in concert halls reaches 105 decibels. Dubstep sounds like dubnium, and the musical notes looks like a "d" and a "b".

name: Seaborgium
phrase: **S**cary cybor**g** (sounds like seaborgium). Its hexagonal eye reminds of the six in 106; its blue eye reminds of the sea.

name: Bohrium
phrase: Niels **B**ohr went to **h**eaven (rhymes with 107).

name: Nihonium
phrase: The Americans were pretty unlucky that the Japanese discovered this element before them. 13 is said to be an unlucky number and **N**i**h**on is another word for Japan.
